How can I retrieve a raw transaction using the Verus command line?

You can retrieve a raw transaction using the `getrawtransaction` command followed by the transaction ID (TXID). For example:
```
verus getrawtransaction "mytxid"
```
This will return the raw transaction data for the specified TXID.

l Examples: > verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" > verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" 1 > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
How can I retrieve a raw transaction with verbose output using the Verus command line?

To retrieve a raw transaction with verbose output, you can add a `1` at the end of the `getrawtransaction` command, like this:
```
verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" 1
```
This will return the raw transaction data with additional verbose information for the specified TXID.

l Examples: > verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" > verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" 1 > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
How can I retrieve a raw transaction using the Verus JSON-RPC API?

You can retrieve a raw transaction using the Verus JSON-RPC API by sending a JSON request to the Verus server. For example, using `curl`:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
This will return the raw transaction data for the specified TXID, with verbose output.

l Examples: > verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" > verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" 1 > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
